newsitem.title: JAPAN: Nippon Credit may be hit by loan guarantees - paper.
newsitem.headline: Nippon Credit may be hit by loan guarantees - paper.

text.p: Loan guarantees made by Nippon Credit Bank Ltd for a financially troubled non-bank unit may affect the bank's business, a Japanese daily said on Wednesday.
A spokesman for Nippon Credit was not immediately available for comment.

The Asahi Shimbun said the bank issued a letter to a financial institution which extended loans of about 240 billion yen to the bank's unit. In the letter, Nippon Credit said it would take responsibility for the unit's management.
Nippon Credit itself extended loans of about 120 billion yen to the unit, the paper said.
The unit's total debts are worth about 1.1 trillion yen and the unit's restructuring has not been smooth, the paper said.

Nippon Credit said the letter was not a loan guarantee but the financial institution which extended loans said it understood that Nippon Credit would cover any losses if the unit could not repay the loan, the paper said.
